revised_title: Investigation of Flame Spectra in Open-hearth and Bessemer Processes
tldr: This article investigates the spectra of flames resulting from the open-hearth and Bessemer processes, focusing on the chemical composition and temperature variations of the flames. The authors identify various elements present in the flames, including rubidium, caesium, calcium, copper, silver, and gallium. They also study the differences in the spectra of flames from open-hearth and cupola furnaces, providing insights into the chemistry of these processes.
